name: The 787 No Service Business Class:  Royal Jordanian Part 1
description:
When is a business class flight not a business class flight?  When it’s only 30 minutes long and all passengers and crew must remain seated with their seat belts on for the entire flight. 

This is exactly what happened on my flight from Tel Aviv, Israel to Amman, Jordan.  Israeli restrictions means we could climb over 8,000 feet which meant seatbelts on for passengers and crew. 

So, whilst this Royal Jordanian business class review may not show much of the Royal Jordanian business class service it does give me the opportunity to show you the Royal Jordanian 787 business class seat.  

And, because we flew so low, the views out of the oversized Boeing 787 windows weren’t bad either!

Enjoy!

Route:     Tel Aviv (TLV) to Amman (AMM)
Length:   69 miles, 0:30 hrs
Flight:     RJ343  Seat 2K
Aircraft:  Boeing 787-8  registration JY-BAA (Aug 2014)
When:    4 July 2019

Camera:  Panasonic HC-VX1


This video may not be reproduced without specific permission.
